Teams » Team Israel

The Cactus Home

Team Israel

Previous Next

House Description

English | 中文

The design concept is to create a cohousing project based on a sharing community. This idea was inspired by the Israeli "kibbutz". The kibbutz is a unique cooperative settlement based on the values of equality between human beings and idealistic & economic cooperation. It was created at the beginning of the twentieth century by immigrants that came from Europe and settled in an empty land. The kibbutz answered for the need for protection and development in many areas simultaneously.

The name derives from the word "group". The kibbutz settlements vary in different communal functions: communal dining room, children's house, shared community and educational centers and communal means of production like vertical farming.

This project focuses on a residential solution to population growth and congestion in the city.

For the competition, the team will plan and build one apartment for a young couple in one store, and parts from shared spaces on the other one. The choice for public spaces will be determined by contest needs, like laundry room for example, and from personal and designed decision making.

As part of a system component, the green wall will combine between the two floors at the house that is designed for the competition as well.

Team Israel will also prioritize the use of environmental and friendly materials which will be provided by Israeli companies specializing in renewable energy technologies. The incorporation of Israeli technologies in the home will allow the project to be showcasing the Israeli sustainable energy industry throughout the competition.

The design approach of the group deals with the integration of a multi-disciplinary work in order to achieve an innovative solution. As designed for optimal solar power and integrated technological elements such as photovoltaics, solar thermal collectors and building-integrated PV, among other pioneering and innovative systems, technologies and products. Alongside these modern technologies, the team will also include distinctive cultural features, such as vegetation, or the “mashrabiya”, a type of oriel window enclosed with carved wooden latticework.

The design will provide a vertical system for home-grown food and herbs, using recycled water. The furniture will be designed to be multi-purpose, combining several functions, including public spaces. It will be produced from sustainable and long-lasting materials such as bamboo and fiber-cement boards.

Using a modular approach, the structural elements, will be covered by panels, which can be easily and affordably replaced.

设计的理念是基于共享社区创立一个共同住宅项目，这个想法来源于以色列的“kibbutz（集体农场）”，集体农场是一个基于人类之间的平等价值观以及理想主义和经济合作的项目，是一个独特的项目。它是由在20世纪初定居下来的欧洲移民者创造的，为满足防御需求和在多领域的同时发展，集体农场应运而生。

这个名字来源于“group（群组）”这个词，集体农场方案会因公共职能的不同而有所变化：如公共餐厅、儿童之家、共享社区和公共教育中心以公共生产方式，比如垂直农业。

本项目重点是针对人口增长和城市拥挤提出住宅解决方案。

为参加本次竞赛，团队将在一间仓库为一对夫妻设计并建造一间公寓，并且与在另一间的共享空间区分开。公共空间的选择将由竞赛要求决定，例如洗衣房，同时也会考虑到个人和设计的决策。

作为系统的组成部分，绿化墙面在住宅的两个楼层间进行结合，该住宅也是为竞赛设计的。

以色列团队将会优先考虑使用环境友好材料，这些材料由专门研究可再生能源技术的以色列公司提供，这些国内的以色列科技公司允许本项目在竞赛中展示以色列的可持续能源工业。

本团队的设计方案涉及整合多学科的工作，实现一体化，以期得到一个创新性的解决方案。本次设计用于优化太阳能和集成技术元素，例如光伏、太阳能集热器、光伏建筑一体化等一些开拓性和创新性的系统、技术和产品。除了这些现代技术之外，团队还会综合考虑一些独特的文化特征，例如植被，或者是“mashrabiya（阿拉伯传统窗花）”，一种由木制的雕刻网格围合起来的凸窗。

本次设计将使用循环水为家庭种植的食物和草药提供垂直系统，家具会被设计成融合了几种职能的多功能家具，这些职能包含了公共空间。家具由可持续并且经久耐用的材料制成，如竹子和纤维水泥板。

采用模块化的方法，结构元素都将被面板覆盖，这些面板十分容易更换，并且很经济。
